pullRequest.body:
Prove the triangle counting lemma. Definitions that are internal to the proof are made private.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

```suggestion (((P.parts.offDiag.filter fun (U, V) ↦ G.edgeDensity U V < ε).biUnion $ ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rwa [← div_le_iff', one_div_div] ```
'reduced graph' is a generic term that has other meanings in graph theory, so change this to e.g. 'regularity_reduced' or similar to avoid ambiguity.
Good point! Renamed to `regularityReduced`

In this name (and throughout this file) you seem to be using 'vertices' to refer to parts of the partition of the big graph G. I understand why conceptually, but given how you've defined reduced graphs maybe would be less confusing to refer to these as parts instead? e.g. call this definition badParts and so on.
I actually think I mean honest to god vertices here? I've updated the docstring to make things clearer.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Triangle counting
